trans-unit.source: The SOAP representation of a server error.

When an XML Web service client adds a SOAP header to an XML Web service method call with the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.MustUnderstand%2A> property set to `true`, the XML Web service method must set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader.DidUnderstand%2A> property to `true`; otherwise, a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException> is thrown.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Detail%2A> property cannot be set according to the SOAP specification for a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException>.
Applications that use the SOAP 1.1 specification as the service protocol can use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException> to access SOAP faults.
However, applications that use the SOAP 1.2 specification must use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException> to access SOAP faults.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class with parameters for controlling serialization.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that contains values that are used during serialization and deserialization.

A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> that contains data about the source and destination of the serialization stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
A reference to the root cause of an exception.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception.
Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception.
Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor"></xref> property.
A reference to the root cause of an exception.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class with the associated data.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception.
Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor"></xref> property.
An URI that represents the role of the XML Web service in the processing of the SOAP message.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Role"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> that contains the contents of the `<subcode>` element of a SOAP fault.
A reference to the root cause of the exception.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderException"></xref> class with the associated data.
A message that identifies the reason the exception occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.Message"></xref> property.
The type of error that occurred.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code"></xref> property.
The piece of code that caused the exception.
Typically, this is a URL to an XML Web service method.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Actor"></xref> property.
An URI that represents the role of the XML Web service in the processing of the SOAP message.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Role"></xref> property.
A string that identifies the human language associated with the exception.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Lang"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> that contains the contents of the `subcode` element of a SOAP fault.
A reference to the root cause of an exception.
This parameter sets the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property.
